node.category: What is the way things are?
Should complementary medicine be covered by insurance companies?

node.surface: Health insurance companies should not cover treatment in complementary medicine
unless the promised effect and its medical benefit have been concretely proven.

node.category: Is there usually proof behind that?

node.surface: Yet this very proof is lacking in most cases.

node.category: Does complementart medicine help the patients?

node.surface: Patients do often report relief of their complaints after such treatments.

node.category: If so, should this be a preferred treatment?

node.surface: But as long as it is unclear as to how this works,
the funds should rather be spent on therapies where one knows with certainty.
